titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Alexis Carrel papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA231

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-26 13:08:08 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Alexis Carrel papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note

eventgrp.event: Professeur à la faculté de médecine, Université de Lyon
University of Chicago, Hull Physiological Laboratory - (type of appointment not verified, but 21 papers published with Dr. Charles C. Guthrie
Fellow, The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York
Sc.D. University of the State of New York

bioghist.p: Numerous medal and honors and membership in many societies.

Alexis Carrel, 1873-1944, physician worked in Experimental Surgery at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research from 1906 until his retirement in 1939. The major portion of his papers were deposited by his widow, Madame Carrel, at Georgetown University Medical School.
Biography: Edwards, W. Sterling. Alexis Carrel, visionary surgeon by William Sterling Edwards and Peter D. Edwards, Springfield, Ill. Charles Thomas 1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs of Dr. Carrel and his laboratory; laboratory alterations and war activities; bibliography and bound volumes of collected reprints; newspaper clippings and box 2 which is primarily administrative correspondence between Alexis Carrel, Simon Flexner and the Business Manager. After 1934 some correspondence is with Herbert Gasser.

Includes material relating to the Rockefeller Institute hospital established in Compiègne, France, during World War I, courses for the treatment of wounds during the war at the Rockefeller Institute's War Demonstration Hospital, and the perfusion pump designed with Charles A. Lindbergh for work in tissue culture.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: See also War Demonstration Hospital records and Business Manager's Subject Files: LINDBERGH, CHARLES A.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Boxes 3 and 4 contain material previously housed in Box 1.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

Box 6 (Original Clipping Book) is closed to scholarly research due to its brittle and fragile condition. Box 5 Archival Copy of the Clipping Book is open and available as the access copy for researchers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Alexis Carrel papers collection is available at Georgetown University, Special Collections. Please consult an archivist for an inventory of the holdings at Georgetown.

Shaw, R. and Stubenford, W.T. NY State J. Med 1980
Wakler, L.C., Surgery, Gynecology, and Obstetrics. 1977
Sherman, William O'Neill, re Carrel method
Miscellaneous reprints, etc. re Carrel work
Campo, A.J. re Keith Porter use of Optical Equipment from Carrel stock
Chesley, Leon C. re loan of Carrel-Lindbergh pump
Georgetown University, re gift of Carrel papers
Letter to Dr. Holt requesting a grant
Letter accepting appointment as member of Rockefeller Institute
Correspondence on arrangements to travel to Sweden to accept Nobel Prize and program honoring Carrel at Presidential reception
Correspondence from France on serum needs of French government; details of hospital and laboratory at Compiègne
Report of Harry Dakin on use of various antiseptic substances
Carrel report: Traitement abortif de l'infection des plaies
Report by American Fund for French wounded, "A visit to Dr. Carrel's Hospital"
"What can be done for improving present condition of War surgery?" Several reports
Handwritten letter indication change of ideas as a result of working with wounded
Correspondence dealing with RI request to release Dr. Carrel to work at War Demonstration Hospital
Correspondence on development of microcinematography for study of cell physiology at Institute
Resume of projected plans for Mousery in studies of environmental effects on incidence of cancer
Handwritten letter from George M. Kober to Simon Flexner announcing choice of Alexis Carrel as 1930 recipient of Nordhoff-Jung prize for cancer research
Correspondence about use of Carrel's name in advertising
Correspondence about construction of perfusion pump apparatus and its demonstration at Congress for Experimental Cytology and loan to Carlsberg Institute

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes drawings of various parts of the apparatus.

did.unittitle: Assorted correspondence at time of retirement
Newspaper items reporting activities in Europe during World War II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiries re Carrel and Carrel's work, some "crank." Replies primarily by secretarial/administrative staff, including Miss Crutcher, E.B. Smith, Douglas Whitaker, Mabel Bright.

did.unittitle: Guida Medica. Enciclopedia Medica per la Famiglia. 11-7-67. Vol. XII

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes cover photo of Careel-Lindbergh pump, text and additional photos on inside front cover and back cover (both sides).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Mrs. Carrel, Mr. and Mrs. Rosenberger, Miss Crutcher, H.D. Dakin, Dr. Ebeling.

did.unittitle: Operating room, War Demonstration Hospital. Carrel demonstration
Index to Carrel portraits in NY Acad. Med. Library Catalog
Artwork: Print, "Carrel, Gallery Rockefeller Institute" by René Vincent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [See p. 66 for additional information and provenance].

did.unittitle: Caricature of Carrel by René Vincent entitled, "Carrel' Gallery Rockefeller Institute"

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Includes memo from J. Lederberg (10/12/1989) explaining that he acquired the print in Paris. Print forwarded to archives from S. Mirsky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notecard attached to papers indicates that these notes were found with T. Mitchell Prudden material (probably found/identified by Ruth Sternfeld, Archivist). Observations on influence of various substances on l) rate of wound healing 2) cicatrization of wounds, in dogs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: * refers to the number on the back of the photocopies.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 5 Archival Copy of the Clipping Book is open and available as the access copy for researchers. Box 6 (Original Clipping Book) is closed to scholarly research due to its brittle and fragile condition.
